body: Gray would probably do the job just as well

Color the identicons maybe?

![screen shot 2014-11-29 at 12 56 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125426/5234365/216a0400-77c7-11e4-9d81-3d94dca0cb0b.png)

Or just the status text?

![screen shot 2014-11-29 at 13 02 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125426/5234378/09907494-77c8-11e4-9b64-16a20df289ed.png)

this kills the progress bar idea :/ 
But I guess it looks more adult this way

I think [idea 2](https://discourse.syncthing.net/t/folder-panel-header-with-progress-indicator/1455) would look nice together with this though.

![idea 2](https://discourse.syncthing.net/uploads/default/688/a69d5cd1c3236ac0.png)
Yeah agree.

What's wrong with the background color? For unused devices/folders I would use gray (unused is not a warning sign for me) and keep the green/purple backgrounds. Also the identicon should not be colored as it serves no real purpose (you never see matching ones unless you use VNC/etc. to the other machine that shares same device.

> I think idea 2 would look nice together with this though.

Really? I'm glad you changed your mind :angry: :unamused:
I had a pull request ready for today after testing the progress bar in many browsers and devices

Yeah, sorry. Grey for me, in this context, didn't look disabled but "default". But really, the other progress bar idea might still work perfectly fine, as a blue progress bar that grows over they grey or something like that?

> Grey for me, in this context, didn't look disabled but "default"

I mean, the orange text for "unused" could be e.g. dark gray -  I see "unused" as intentional not accidental

> blue progress bar that grows over the grey

ok, I will do some testing

There have been many great commits and changes since 0.10.8
When are you planning to release the next version?
Beginning of next week I assume.
ok, I tested a few ideas, please only color the text and not the identicons

issue.title: Folder/device status info

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Since we are in the progress of cleaning up...
- is there a Syncthing folder state = idle, where percent != 100 ?
- is there a Syncthing device state = up to date, where percent != 100?

if not, I suggest to set folder and device status text to "Up to date" (no %) in both cases.
This would also fit better with the [light gray](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1039) GUI (no more fruits :confused: )

body: Sundays are the "traditional" release days, but sometimes earlier and sometimes later.

Yeah the colored text looks good, colored identicons not so much. And the identicon color is also often used to increase the namespace (e.g. on github).

I think a thin blue progress bar in the lower part of the grey panel-heading class would look rather good.

Basically the first one of those but with grey instead of blue and blue instead of red:
![progress-bar](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/7b3988d8bf6d766a84d17d41ea1dae102b8261f8/68747470733a2f2f646973636f757273652e73796e637468696e672e6e65742f75706c6f6164732f64656661756c742f3638382f613639643563643163333233366163302e706e67)

Edit: maybe put it on the top instead of the bottom, to prevent it from becoming bottom-heavy.

> thin blue progress bar

I already had the this idea a few hours ago :wink: and started to implement it, but I will wait for the 0.10.9 release before I commit the changes because some file locations have changed
@uok Awesome! Could you make one mockup with the thin blue progress bar on top and one where it is at the bottom?

The new GUI in 10.9.0 is all gray now.

That's pretty boring and imo makes for worse overview. I'd prefer to tone some of the colors down instead (eg use green/blue/purple/black).

(but maybe I just have to get used to it)

Yeah it looks a little bit boring. I've made a qick+dirty mockup where the borders are 2px (instead of one) and colored the same way as the text.
What do you think?

![09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6797943/5239073/0af749a0-78d3-11e4-8db7-90d8fe3b0984.png)

The writing doesn't really fit the original because I didn't have a browser with good debugging capabilities at hand.

We should probably think of doing something more interesting with the own device section in the top right, but I kept it grey for now.

If we take this approach, we might need to color the thin progress bars the same as the border or neutral like dark grey.

@generalmanager 
please post progress bar ideas to #1033 

Here is my idea for folders and devices
![color](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9367272/5239346/b0caa222-78de-11e4-92e3-bff844376f0f.png)
@uok Will do! I think your version would look really nice with a 2px border.
@generalmanager I'd keep the border only on the header, and maybe make it more white/grey, because the contrast is too high like this imo.
